intro: Muehlenbeckia fruticulosa, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, pale green to silver leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
